body.p: CASE.—Private Benjamin D. Cargill, 2d Vermont Volunteers, aged 19 years, received, at the battle of SpottsylvaniaSpotsylvania Court House, Virginia, May 8th, 1864, a gunshot wound of the anterior portion of the scalp. He was admitted to the hospital of the Second Division, Sixth Corps, and, on May 26th, sent to the Lincoln Hospital, Washington, D. C. Furloughed on May 24th, he was readmitted on June 23d, and died on August 8th, 1864, of acute bronchitis.
